messages.subject: Re: New to Unschooling Question -
messages.msgSnippet: hello, i found that with my young one(two) we stopped with pjs for a while and just had her pick a new outfit to wear especially if we had an early morning the
messages.messageBody:
hello, i found that with my young one(two) we stopped with pjs for a while
and just had her pick a new outfit to wear especially if we had an early
morning the next day. She found it fun also to "picnic" in the car for
breakfast. I had a few foods easily consumed in the car and let her make
some choices from them. She thought it was fun:) and it saved us a half hour
when we needed to get somewhere like an apt. that did not allow us the
flexibility of time. Just a few ideas that have worked for us.
kim-- newbie to unschooling

--
Education is not the filling of a pail but the lighting of a fire "~ William
Butler Yeats~
�I am always ready to learn, but I do not always like being taught.�
by Winston Churchill


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
